label: Government information use limited to contract purposes
quote: Any information made available to the Contractor by the Government shall be used only for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this contract and shall not be divulged or made known in any manner to any persons except as may be necessary in the performance of the contract.
section: D.4 DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION (MAR 2003) - A. General

label: Restriction on use/disclosure of proprietary technical data
quote: The Contractor shall not use, disclose, reproduce, or otherwise divulge or transfuse to any persons any technical information or data licensed for use by the Government that bears any type of restrictive or proprietary legend except as may be necessary in the performance of the contract.
section: D.4 DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION (MAR 2003) - B. Technical Data Rights

label: Protection of confidentiality of Government records and data
quote: In performance of this contract the Contractor assumes the responsibility for protection of the confidentiality of all Government records and/or protected data provided for performance under the contract and shall ensure that (a) all work performed by any subcontractor is subject to the disclosure restrictions set forth above and (b) all subcontract work be performed under the supervision of the Contractor or their employees.
section: D.4 DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION (MAR 2003) - C. Privacy Act

label: No performance of inherently Governmental functions
quote: The Contractor shall not perform any inherently Governmental functions under this contract as described in Office of Federal Procurement Policy Letter 92-1

label: Contractor employees exercise judgment on behalf of contractor
quote: the Contractor's employees will act and exercise personal judgment and discretion on behalf of the Contractor.

label: No appearance of contractor personnel as Government employees
quote: Contractor personnel under this contract shall not: (a) Be placed in a position where there is an appearance that they are employed by the Government or are under the supervision, direction, or evaluation of any Government employee.

label: Contractor personnel must not claim to be Government representatives
quote: (b) Hold him or herself out to be a Government employee, agent or representative or state orally or in writing at any time that he or she is acting on behalf of the Government.

label: Contractor employees must identify company in third-party communications
quote: In all communications with third parties in connection with this contract, Contractor employees shall identify themselves as such and specify the name of the company of which they work.

label: No contractor personnel in command or control over Government or other contractors
quote: (c) Be placed in a position of command, supervision, administration or control over Government personnel or personnel of other Government contractors, or become a part of the government organization.

label: Contractor employees must state no authority to change contract
quote: In all communications with other Government Contractors in connection with this contract, the Contractor employee shall state that they have no authority to change the contract in any way.

label: Contractor must notify CO of potential personal service relationship
quote: If the Contractor believes any Government action or communication has been given that would create a personal service relationship between the Government and any Contractor employee, the Contractor shall promptly notify the CO of this communication or action.

label: Compliance with CBP rules and regulations for personnel
quote: Rules, regulations directives and requirements which are issued by U.S. Customs & Border Protection under their responsibility for good order, administration and security are applicable to all personnel who enter U.S. Customs & Border Protection installations or who travel on Government transportation.

label: No on-site performance on Federal holidays except as defined
quote: Except for designated around-the-clock or emergency operations, and/or as defined within the statement of requirements, contractor personnel will not be able to perform on site under this contract with CBP on the holidays set forth above.

label: No holiday charges as direct contract charge
quote: The contractor will not charge any holiday as a direct charge to the contract.

label: No extension or price adjustment for holiday observance except as set forth
quote: Observance of such days by Government personnel shall not be cause for an extension to the delivery schedule or period of performance or adjustment to the price, except as set forth in the contract.

label: Dismissal of contractor personnel during site closure
quote: on-site contractor personnel shall also be dismissed if the site is being closed.

label: Provision of sufficient personnel for critical efforts during site closure
quote: the Contractor shall continue to provide sufficient personnel to perform around-the-clock requirements of critical efforts already in progress or scheduled and shall be guided by the instructions issued by the Contracting Officer or her/his duly appointed representative.

label: Contractor staff actions during site closure per company policy
quote: the Contractor will direct its staff as necessary to take actions such as reporting to its own site(s) or taking appropriate leave consistent with its policies.

label: Contractor employees must identify themselves as company employees
quote: The Contractor will ensure that its employees will identify themselves as employees of their respective company while working on U.S. Customs & Border Protection (CBP) contracts.

label: Contractor personnel must use specified email signature format
quote: The contractor will ensure that their personnel use the following format signature on all official e-mails generated by CBP computers:

label: Contractor pre-screening for access to facilities or sensitive information
quote: Contractors requiring recurring access to Government facilities or access to sensitive but unclassified information and/or logical access to Information Technology (IT) resources shall verify minimal fitness requirements for all persons/candidates designated for employment under any Department of Homeland Security (DHS) contract by pre-screening the person/candidate prior to submitting the name for consideration to work on the contract.
section: D.8 SPECIAL SECURITY REQUIREMENT - CONTRACTOR PRE-SCREENING

label: Submission of candidates without recent felony or drug use
quote: The Contractor shall submit only those candidates that have not had a felony conviction within the past 36 months, illegal drug use within the past 12 months from the date of submission of their name as a candidate to perform work under this contract.
section: D.8 SPECIAL SECURITY REQUIREMENT - CONTRACTOR PRE-SCREENING

label: Flow down of pre-screening requirement to subcontractors
quote: Contractors are required to flow this requirement down to subcontractors.
section: D.8 SPECIAL SECURITY REQUIREMENT - CONTRACTOR PRE-SCREENING

label: Pre-screening review of felony convictions
quote: Pre-screening involves contractors and subcontractors reviewing: a. Felony convictions within the past 36 months: An acceptable means of obtaining information on felony convictions is from public records, free of charge, or from the National Crime Information Center (NCIC).
section: D.8 SPECIAL SECURITY REQUIREMENT - CONTRACTOR PRE-SCREENING

label: Pre-screening review of pending/unresolved criminal charges
quote: b. Pending/open/unresolved criminal charges of any nature: An acceptable means of obtaining information related to unresolved criminal charges is through employee self-certification, by public records check, or other reference checks conducted in the normal course of business.
section: D.8 SPECIAL SECURITY REQUIREMENT - CONTRACTOR PRE-SCREENING
